intro: Waltheria mollis, commonly known as the yellow marsh mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in wetland habitats and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation.
